author: Staff Reporter
text:
Eight cases were disposed of in a special Lok Adalat held in the district jail here on Saturday.

Inaugurating the special Lok Adalat, Principal District Judge R. Poornima said Department of Judiciary has been monitoring meticulously if there were any human rights violations in jail or not. Circumstances made persons accused. Inmates should read more books for a change in mind set, she said.

“When you come out of the jail, you should have turned a good person. Every inmate should have an ambition to become a good man, she advised.

The Adalat had taken up 12 cases for hearing and disposed of six cases.

Chief Judicial Magistrate S. Jeganathan, Principal Sub Judge and District Legal Service Authority Secretary K. Karunanidhi, Additional Sub Judge A. Deepa and Judicial Magistrates K. Kavitha, C.B. Vedagiri, M. Seyadhu Sulaiman Ussain conducted the Adalat.

Palani court

In Palani court, the Judicial Magistrate, N. Saravana Kumar, took five cases for hearing and disposed of two cases.
title: Special Lok Adalat in district jail
